There is a big flat screen TV Now the downside: My room (n° 34) was ridiculously small, even by Parisian standards. I couldn't even walk around the bed. The bathroom, though aiming at modern and sober, with its whirlpool bathtub and integrated changing lighting, was unpractical to say the least. There is not a single hook or railing to hang used towels. The smallish shelf over the wash basin was not designed to accomodate more than a toothbrush and a couple of glasses. There is no curtain on the bathtub, so taking a shower will invariably flood the whole bathroom, including, with some skill, your toilet paper. The matress was excessively firm and there is a plastic sheet under the regular sheet (presumably to protect the matress from any unwanted damages). Quite unpleasant. Price wise, I found my room to be anything but cheap at 170 euros a night. A rate of about 140 euros a night would be more appropriate. All in all, not a bad hotel, but I won't return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChadSemans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were extremely pleased with our stay at this hotel. The location was perfect. We had an incredible view of the river Seine and Notre Dame from our hotel window. Shopping and many restaurants were just a short walk away. The staff were very friendly and helpful with all of our travel needs. This was our first stay in Paris and if we return we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingbob
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic and the views from the room about as good as it gets in Paris. The staff were friendly and the rooms beautifully decorated. Clean stylish bathrooms too. In terms of style and comfort its 4 star, and in fact almost as good as some 5 star hotels I've stayed in. It had no restaurant, just a lounge area where you have breakfast...but who needs a restaurant in the hotel when you step out the door and have a choice of a hundred restaurants within a few hundred metres.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel, location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: CheshirePhill
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Paris as a romantic surprise birthday treat April 24/25th 2010. I choose the hotel based on some of the reviews I saw on Tripadvisor, and was not disappointed. Beware the similarly named hotels in Paris - this one is bang opposite Notre Dame cathedral and has tremendous views of it and over the Seine (Petit Pont bridge). We had a standard room, which had some pretty unique decoration - best see the hotel website, one entire wall had some kind of mural on it, but it was nice, a countryside scene, I think. The room wasn't huge, but the facilities were good and clean. Good shower and ensuite facilities, nice flatscreen TV and clock/radio/iDock, which would have come in handy if I had taken my iPod!! The view was fantastic - the room had three windows, on two sides, looking straight out at Notre Dame cathedral. We loved the location, it was right on the river, very easily within a stones throw....and consequently really easy to walk to lots of major attractions like Saint Chapelle, La Conciergie, The Louvre etc. I would say as a result of the great location, it is very busy. Lots of people and traffic right outside the windows, up until late on. However, with double-glazed windows shut and aircon on (it was 26C when we were there) we had no trouble sleeping right through (pounding the streets all day helps too!). However, we did hear other guests in the hotel at times, some with young children. Great atmosphere around the hotel area, lots of young people (students) enjoying the banks of the Seine, chatting, drinking, playing instruments, right through the evening only a short walk from the hotel. We loved this, it was all really, really nice, not noisy/threatening/irritating in any way at all. Amazingly, there was NO litter left anywhere the following morning - the Parisian refuse collection system is to be congratulated as well as the people themselves! The service was great. The front desk (both lady and gent) were very helpful, recommending local restaurants, calling taxis if required, offering room service, and best of all, no problem at all storing our luggage on the day we checked out for as long as we liked. Oh, and also a plus for location, the RER/St. Michel Notre-Dame metro station has an exit across the road, which means if you travel in from CDG airport with cases, you only have to wheel it about 20m across the street! Very handy! The desk was manned at all times, with a secure exit in/out of the hotel. Slightly tricky to find, it is accessed via a small glass door at the RH side of the brasserie below, and is from first floor upwards. We returned around 2am one night and were immediately let back in with no delay. Breakfast was fine, breads, croissants and jam, tea and coffee at 9 euros each. Great cafe across the street also serves bacon, eggs etc., and our breakfast there was a little more at around 12 euros pp. The hotel has a sauna, but we didn't have time to use that...too busy!! All in all, this is exactly what you need for a sightseeing, walking trip to central Paris, and comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than this hotel. Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: lemmingstone
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a one night Eurostar trip from London. I had no expectations of the hotel other than its proximity to Notre Dame (directly across the street). I have stayed at other Paris hotels and expected something similar. It was fantastic. The location was about as central to main tourist sites as possible. Everything is within close walking distance and Paris is of course a beautiful city to do some walking. The hotel itself is cool. Great interior design and modern facilities. Rooms were very comfortable and our view was of Notre dame and the Seine. The staff were excellent and the overnight staff in particular went to great lengths to help my wife in an emergency. Great place to stay and will definately stay here again when in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel le Notre Dame
HotelInfo.Address: 1 quai Saint-Michel | 5th Arr., 75005 Paris, France
